result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Edwin Deyo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas Edwin Deyo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas Edwin Deyo was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct as a County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cover Letter

Defendant Thomas Edwin Deyo in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Viney advises offer has been received.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  VIS reviewed by all parties.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1: Dismissed

Count 2: Amend to county ordinance 11.03

$200.50 fine, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan - CASH BOND APPLY

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas Edwin Deyo in court.  Court questions DE on petition.  DE states as of today they no longer have FoodShare and there are other economic changes.  Court questions what happened to the first two attorneys that were appointed.  DE responds.  Court advises DE re: his right to counsel as this is the third attorney the DE has had appointed in one way or another.  DE currently working at Humane.  Court appoints Atty Joe Viney (137 3rd Ave, Baraboo 53913 (608) 356-2159).  To reimburse COC's office $35/week beginning 12/15/2016 and then every week thereafter.  Wage assignment to be completed.
Indigency hearing on December 7, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas Edwin Deyo
Current: 154 W Maple, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2016)
Prior: 510 Willow St 3, Baraboo, WI 53913
Granting Withdrawal

Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Return date on December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas Edwin Deyo in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Sacra states this is a motion to withdraw as counsel.  Has spoken to DE and he is not opposed to the motion.  DE will retain his own counsel.  Atty Sacra notes Atty Tsai was appointed by PD's office and then he was appointed.  Court notes PD's office regulations re: requesting new counsel.  Atty Sacra notes PD's office that they won't appoint a new attorney as DE has already had two appointed.  Explains that he has told DE he will have to retain private counsel.  DE is in agreement.  Court explains process to DE.  DE still wishes to hire private counsel as he's started back at his job and can now afford it.  State doesn't object to granting of the motion.  Court grants motion to withdraw as counsel.  Atty Sacra provides the file to the DE in court today.  CSR has previously been provided but suggests a new PTC be set but will leave that to the DE.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
by mail
